data.text:
@RightsRobins A great day in our long fight against Covid
#lestweforget

@RightsRobins Looking back at those times, it is interesting how some like Sridhar were the acceptable face of Zero Covid, talking about how great life was in NZ and Aus... and then Hyde and others started saying the quiet part out loud, I'm sure DS and the other normies hate them for it.
@RightsRobins Incredible that this probably wouldn't rank within the top 10-20 most insane COVID takes if it was tweeted out today
@D__Melb Very very moving 🙏 Let's remember those who fell for this fateful day
@RightsRobins They observed 17/22 day in Perth, Western Australia and erected a memorial monument in honour. Brought a tear to the eye in these dark times https://t.co/3EhXuGnbC9

I think this thread did a lot of damage to the ZeroCovid crowd as it was picked up by bigger accounts as well: it exemplifies pretty well the ''no trade-offs'' belief, the absolutism, how there's bare life dominated by Covid and not much else going on.

Looking back, a year ago most of Europe was shut, the vaccination campaign was barely just starting (and many countries were accused of being too slow), and proponents of elimination were taken much more seriously. What a ride eh?
